About

I am Ngoc Tran. Computer aficionado. Indie music lover. Part-time swimmer.

OBJECTIVES

Besides being enthusiastic about making web a rich and interactive environment, I am also intrigued by creating information systems for business intelligent, health care and education. In the future, I see myself working towards fulfilling these personal interests and social benefits.

PROFESSIONAL LIFE

I graduated with 1st ranking in CS major from International University, Vietnam National University in 2010. Since 2011, I have been working as a software engineer at InBusiness AS, where I developed several CMS and CRM in Coldfusion and PHP, web and mobile apps in Javascript frameworks, CSS3 and HTML5.

In Fall 2013, I was fortunately granted a scholarship that allows me to pursue Master degree in any Belgian university. I chose to study Master of Computer Science at Vrije Universiteit Brussel, a public university located in Brussels (Belgium). I have learnt so much knowledge during two years at the school. Even some of things I would never apply, I can see they have changed me forever in the way I observe and evaluate problems in the field.

In Fall 2015, I was granted both NICTA scholarship and Swinburne Scholarship to pursue Ph.D at Swinburne University of Technology (Melbourne, Australia). I now become part of Swinburne Software Innovation Lab in a new project where I will research a data mining model using extensive sets of clinical data, and build on top such model a Domain Specific Visual Language to support medial practitioners.

Update 08/2016:

  • NICTA has been merged to CSIRO under a new brand name Data61. I am proud of being a part of CSIRO.
  • My journey has been so interesting and challenging to ride on when I am principally supervised by Prof. Jean-Guy Schneider (Swinburne University), Prof. Rajesh Vasa (Deakin University), Ingo Weber (Data61/CSIRO and University of NSW) and Dr. Elif Ekinci (Austin Hospital and University of Melbourne).

PERSONAL STUFFS

My feelings are influenced by indie music. I am a big fan of Bon Iver. I am also looking for partners in a non-mainstream music site project.

I am also an amateur photographer. You can find some pictures in Flickr and Instagram.

Daily swimming makes me less introverted and get my body into shape. Thanks a bundle for that!

WHY newbiettn?

‘newbiettn’ is no more than a random choice of nickname I’ve made when in high school. Even so, it conveys a few meanings. Whereas ‘ttn’ is an abbreviation of my full name, the term ‘newbie’ is a slang word, referring to one that is new to something. It was me specifically, a newcomer of computer technology. Yet it’s not the end of story. There’s still an extending part of it, which I like much more than the literal meaning. Back in time, I was looking for a nickname that is capable of portraying me, not only in the present but also in many years to come. Then I thought of me somewhat as an curiosity junkie, who always seeks new things in the field, like a newcomer. That’s why I decided to use the term ‘newbie’ as part of my forever nickname.

FAVORITE QUOTES

“We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done” – Alan Turing

    THIS SITE

    When I was a child, I never thought writing would be of my interest. I always got struck by assignments of writing in school. That’s why it was seemingly certain to see a version of me would never start to write something, even meaningless, in spare time in the future. But when I grow up, that version is never a part of me. I realise one of best things I’ve ever done in my life is writing, and I see how much I have learnt when writing becomes a salient trait of me.

    This is the latest version of the site. I used Mura in the past, but now I’m with WordPress

    Updated in August 2016: Wordpress is over, Jekyll is too simple to be ignored.
